author: Milford Mirror
title: Football: Foran defeats Lyman Hall, 55-18
text:
The Foran High football team rode the passing arm of Lance DiNatale to a 55-18 victory over Lyman Hall in Wallingford on Saturday. 
DiNatale, a junior, was 17 of 23 passing for three touchdowns. 
Jared Hubler caught 8 passes for 182 yards. He also threw a 27-yard touchdown to Matt Cleary. 
R.J. Balado ran for 133 yards on 22 carries, as coach Jeff Bevino’s Lions improved to 4-0. 
Colin Firmender caught a 30-yard touchdown pass and Cleary kicked the first of his six conversions in the first quarter. 
Balado ran for a 10-yard score, before Steve Lynch returned an interception 40 yards for a 21-0 lead to open the second period. 
Firmender (10-yard pass) and Hubler (5-yard run) tallied before Hubler surprised the Trojans with his touchdown pass. 
Lyman Hall’s Cam Egana scored on a 25-yard run to take the score to 42-6 at the half. 
The Lions’ Matt Cruz scored on a 2-yard run and DiNatale connected with Hubler from 30 yards out. Will Mauro’s PAT completed the scoring for Foran. 
Egana (5-yard run) and Kyle Bonet (25-yard pass from Egana) put the final points on the board for the Trojans (1-4). 
Next up, a home game with New London on Friday at 7. Related posts:
